oai_dc:dc.dc:title: CCC Insignia Patch, Yellow
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Circular yellow felt patch embroidered in green thread with a tree-filled landscape and the letters ""CCC"" centrally located on the patch.

In 1939 this circular patch with the landscape design became the official insignia for the Civilian Conservation Corps. It was to be worn on the left shoulder and also on the Army-issue wool cap that paired with the CCC dress uniform.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Civilian Conservation Corps (U.S.); United States. Soil Conservation Service; United States. Forest Service; Forests and forestry -- United States; United States -- History -- 1933-1945
